quote_first: At first, the change of scene appeared to be working. He managed to digest the roast beef sandwich and asparagus salad he ordered for lunch. At
quote_last: he met a friend’s girlfriend in the hotel tearoom, where he sent his stomach a piece of cherry pie and black coffee, which also stayed down.
title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
author: Haruki Murakami

quote_first: They found two unlocked bicycles in Holder Court and rode out about
title: This Side of Paradise
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote_first: Before I am rrroasting the alarm-clock, I am setting it to go off, not at nine o'clock the next morning, but at
quote_last: the next afternoon. Vhich means half-past thrrree this afternoon. And that, she said, glancing at her wrist-watch, "is in prrree-cisely seven minutes' time!"
title: The Witches
author: Roald Dahl

quote_first: I must have completed my packing with time to spare, for when the knock came on my door at
quote_last: precisely, I had been sitting in my chair waiting for a good while. I opened the door to a young Chinese man, perhaps not even twenty, dressed in a gown, his hat in his hand.
title: When We Were Orphans
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
